channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lights not detecting vehicles, 27th March
item.description:
From Cheltenham towards Gloucester Same issue as 20th march
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrove Way, Springbank, Cheltenham

item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Abandoned Mud on Road sign, 26th March
item.description:
This is yet another Mud on Road sign relating to the incident before Christmas. I hadn't noticed this sign until now. It is currently within the West Down Car Park on Cleeve Common on the left just by the entrance. BUT it is definitely a Glos Highways sign. I hope it is removed more quickly than the similar sign at the top of Park Lane, which was removed on Thursday.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Lane, Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 huge potholes in road to Whitehall and Cleeve Common from Whittington / Syreford, 26th March
item.description:
These are 2 separate potholes on the right side of the road driving up to West Down Car Park on Cleeve Common. They are both less than 50 yards from the car park entrance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal Cover, 26th March
item.description:
One of the two metal covers is loose, when vehicles drive over it, it is noisy. They are two in close proximity. What 3 words locations: races.fund.darling/ grapes.shall.props
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cousley Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Danger!, 26th March
item.description:
This road is now dangerous. I know it's been reported and therefore you will be aware. Its been in the local news and you've been out and resurfaced the wrong end of the road. As you are aware of the issues I'll also assume that you'll be taking responsibility when someone inevitably gets hurt or worse. This week alone I've seen a motorcyclist very nearly come off of their bike after attempting to navigate this stretch of road. It's not good enough.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Caernarvon Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding still an issue, 26th March
item.description:
The drain is blocked. Whoever is reporting this as "resolved" needs sacking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Portland Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Heading up the hill the inner corner of the road is back to being like a ploughed field… Two months after it was “repaired”., 26th March
item.description:
Inside corner heading up the hill. Can I ask a FOI request about how much you paid to “repair” this section of the road 2 months ago?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 26th March
item.description:
There is a nearly constant stream of detritus dumped on the corner of Pates Avenue and Alstone Lane. Happens on a weekly basis. Why not put up a camera and be proactive and prosecute someone in order to deter this happening so frequently? Today’s exhibits include a mattress, cupboard and a lovely set of speakers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approaching Barnwood Builders from Walls roundabout the red light is on for a long time. When green light finally comes on only 4 cars can get over. Tailbacks as far as the vets sometimes. Exiting Greenways the green light is on longer than the green light on the main road, 26th March
item.description:
Lights at junction with Greenways estate by Barnwood Builders just before North Upton Lane Timings of lights are now different to before the resurfacing work when there were temporary lights in place. The timings seem to have switched over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenways, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: When is road being reopened?, 26th March
item.description:
Closing this road and not mending it has increased the traffic on an already busy road(badgeworth Road). It is also meaning that we have to use the more dangerous The Reddings to access our house as turning right is very difficult due to the hedge blocking sight of the road. I have had many frights as so difficult to see. Also cars turning right into The Reddings cut the corner and accidents have happened.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
